videoSnippet.title: Carlsen Crushes Nakamura While Making a Sandwich - Chess.com Speedchess Championship Finals
videoSnippet.description:
#agadmator Peter Doggers: 
Four days after winning the FIDE World Blitz Championship Magnus Carlsen hadn't lost his form yet. With even bigger numbers than last year (18 to 9 this time), the Norwegian again defeated Hikaru Nakamura in the final on Wednesday and won the 2017 Chess.com Speed Chess Championship convincingly.

Read the entire article here https://www.chess.com/news/view/carlsen-beats-nakamura-18-9-wins-2017-speed-chess-championship

Hikaru Nakamura vs Magnus Carlsen 
Chess.com Speedchess Championship Finals 2018.
5+3,  2018, Jan-3
Indian Game (A45)

1. d4 Nf6 2. Bf4 b6 3. Nf3 Bb7 4. e3 e6 5. h3 Bd6 6. Bxd6 cxd6 7. Nbd2 O-O 8. Bd3 d5 9. c3 d6 10. O-O Ba6 11. Bxa6 Nxa6 12. a4 Nc7 13. Qe2 h6 14. Rfc1 Qd7 15. c4 dxc4 16. Rxc4 Rac8 17. Rac1 Ncd5 18. Ne1 Nb4 19. Nd3 Rxc4 20. Rxc4 Nxd3 21. Qxd3 d5 22. Rc1 Qxa4 23. Qc3 Qb5 24. b3 Qe2 25. Qc2 a5 26. Ne4 Qxc2 27. Nxf6+ gxf6 28. Rxc2 b5 29. Kf1 Ra8 30. Ke2 a4 31. b4 a3 32. Ra2 Ra4 33. Kd2 Rxb4 34. Rxa3 Rb2+ 35. Ke1 b4 36. Ra8+ Kg7 37. Rb8 h5 38. g4 h4 39. Kf1 b3 40. Kg2 Rb1 41. Kf3 e5 42. Kg2 b2 43. Rb5 Kf8 44. Rb7 Ke8 45. g5 exd4 46. exd4 fxg5 47. Rb8+ Kd7
